content:
Explain what the given phrase means.
In the wee hours of the morning

The phrase "in the wee hours of the morning" refers to the very early hours of the day, typically just after midnight and before dawn. These hours are often characterized by quietness and stillness, as most people are still asleep. The term "wee" is a Scottish word meaning "small" or "little," so the phrase essentially means "in the small hours of the morning."
